conclusion: Analyze how shadows A, B, C, and D will change when the light source moves forward above the objects, considering both position and size changes.
Object A: Red mushrooms
Object B: A branch or small decorative object
Object C: A white bunny figure
Object D: A book
The shadows (labeled A, B, C, and D in the first image) are cast on a textured surface.
When a light source moves forward (closer to the objects), several changes occur to the shadows.
All shadows will move closer to their respective objects when the light source moves forward.
The distance between each object and its shadow will decrease when the light source moves forward.
All shadows will become smaller as the light source moves forward.
As the light source gets closer, less light is blocked by the object relative to the total light spreading out.
Shadows will become sharper and more defined as the light source moves forward.
The light source becomes more of a point source relative to the objects.
Shadow A will move closer to the mushrooms.
Shadow A will become smaller and more concentrated.
The distinctive mushroom cap shape will remain but be more compact.
Shadow B will move closer to the object.
Shadow B will become smaller.
The intricate details of the object may become more visible in the shadow.
Shadow C will move closer to the bunny figure.
Shadow C will become smaller.
The distinctive ears and rounded body shape will remain but be more compact.
Shadow D will move closer to the book.
Shadow D will become smaller.
The rectangular shape will remain but be more compact.
